text:
Sheldon's motivation to lear Mandarin 
is to confront the people in charge of

the Chinese restaurant so in this hilarious 
clip Sheldon shows us some things not to do

when speaking English. You know sometimes it 
can be really helpful to think about what you

shouldn't do when speaking a language so you 
can stop making mistakes that get in your way.

To learn more check out this 
lesson that Andrea made next

and for those of you that are new here remember to 
hit that subscribe button and the bell down below.

So every week we can help you to understand fast 
speaking natives without getting lost, without

missing the jokes and without subtitles like 
Alexandra who says that our lessons help her to

advance her English and progress faster! Now let's 
jump into this hilarious clip with Big Bang Theory

If you intend to do something you plan to 
do it. This is the verb form of intention.

To confront here it means to talk to 
someone about a problem or argument.

I have a question for you do you get frustrated 
when you can't understand fast speaking natives?

I know you don't want to 
struggle like Sheldon did.

So we created this Master Class they'll help 
you to understand natives no matter how fast

we speak by learning the vocabulary that natives 
really use every day pronunciation, how we cut

and connect our words together , understanding all 
the jokes by learning about the cultural context

and it's absolutely free! You will not 
find it here on YouTube you'll have to

click up here or down the description below 
to learn more and sign up. Let's now watch
scene B!

And hey if you want to prove your accent when 
you speak English I made this lesson giving you

five tips to speak english 
more clearly and fluently.

Check that out after you finish this lesson by 
clicking up here or down in the description below.

About 80 of interactions in English are actually 
between non-natives and non-natives so it's more

important that people from Taiwan and Germany 
and Brazil can understand you than just people

from a native speaking country like the US or the 
UK plus when you have an accent in my opinion it

makes you sound more exotic and interesting 
when you speak all right so whether your goal

is to have more of a native-like accent or to 
just improve your comprehensibility when you

speak English these five simple exercises 
are really going to work wonders for you
